channel.title: EasyRsc Highscores - Possible?
channel.description:
I've been looking up some things on how to read .txt files with php. Im not figuring this out.
Any one knows if this is possible? any hints? :|
Thanks! ;D

item.title: EasyRsc Highscores - Possible?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote author=marc110 link=topic=501582.msg3718460#msg3718460 date=1313790098]sql is way too much hassle

Only if you don’t know what you’re doing. Without SQL my job would be made a lot harder. In fact, RSCE wouldn’t even be up without SQL as I simply couldn’t be bothered with text files.

Learn SQL, it will benefit you even after the days of RuneScape.[/quote]
SQL will benefit you in more places then one, webhosting, networking, ect. ect.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRsc Highscores - Possible?
item.dc:creator: @marc110 marc110
item.description:
@marc110 wrote:

It’s possible but more hassle than it’s worth. To make it fast you’d need to loop through and cache the results in highscores.txt (or ideally a database) so you don’t have to loop through every players file on every highscores page load. It would be far easier to just use a SQL based server base (such as RSCDarmon/RSCAngel).

sql is way too much hassle

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRsc Highscores - Possible?
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“putaz, post:9, topic:404563”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=501582.msg3670764#msg3670764 date=1310914409]

Lets say you have 100 people online and 800 .cfg files. so it needs open/pull data/close the 100 files constantly. It will go very slow and draw much momory which can make the server go slow.

EasyRSC St0r k had a highscore which was looped, to keep it updated you had to index it from a bottom.

Lol it’s so stupid to host website at same server as the game.
Lol’d at momory.
[/quote]

I lol’d so you are be stupid aswell? or not because if you smart enough it works very well[/quote]
I are no be stupid aswell. I just never bothered to buy dedicated server(I never had one to be honest, who’s gonna spend money on a RSC Server lol)

Read full topic

Why not just let the script update every hour? Instead of when someone saves data.

That worked aswell.

item.title: EasyRsc Highscores - Possible?
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

[quote=“x killa, post:3, topic:404563”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=501582.msg3669789#msg3669789 date=1310838852]
It’s possible but more hassle than it’s worth. To make it fast you’d need to loop through and cache the results in highscores.txt (or ideally a database) so you don’t have to loop through every players file on every highscores page load. It would be far easier to just use a SQL based server base (such as RSCDarmon/RSCAngel).
[/quote]

Thanks for the fast response. I totally understand. ;D That would be a lot of work for nothing.
Would it be much work to make if you save the player stats in a sql database ? for EasyRcsc

It would be much easier to use rscangel source, but somehow no one can re-upload it without a virus or something?

So im kinda stuck with Easyrsc :([/quote]
It shouldn’t be hard. Just make the players stats save to a sql database every time they logout. It’s been done on RS2 With text files(I did it on a Rs2 I hosted), I don’t see why it can’t be done on easy rsc since it uses text files as well.

It would be much easier to use rscangel source, but somehow no one can re-upload it without a virus or something?
You posted a topic the other day about this, they gave you the moparrsc source\client. I even posted the RscAngel source for you which I found using the Search Button.

Read full topic
